doc.field: CDU presents electoral platform

In Schwerin today the CDU/CSU presented the second part of its electoral platform, the reconstruction East and the social policy. Reconstruction must have top priority. In terms of social policy, CDU and CSU promise stronger family support. According to the state premier of Brandenburg, Stolpe, the electoral platform of the CDU/CSU has crucial deficiencies. In an interview with Deutschlandradio Berlin, he said that he misses clear and reliable facts in this paper. CDU and CSU do not mention the recent development, that the number of regular jobs in the new states is decreasing. The Greens said the presentation was unsatisfactory.
Schroeder criticised for plan to phase out atomic energy

The plan of SPD candidate for Chancellor Schroeder to stop using atomic energy as fast possible caused heavy reactions. The Minister of Economics, Rexrodt (FDP) accused Schroeder of preparing the German economy to leave the technological world league. Additio0nally, he would endanger 40.000 highly qualified jobs . The Minister of Research, Ruettgers (CDU) said that after shutting down German nuclear power plants, atomic energy would have to be imported from France or Eastern Europe. The Greens welcomed Schroeder's plan. They consider it an interesting starting point for negotiations with the SPD on energy policy. It was announced this weekend that if Schroeder wins the elections, he plans to shut down the six oldest German nuclear power plants. For the rest of the nuclear power plants, a phasing-out timetable should be set up.
Search in Lassing continues: Two bubbles surmised

Despite the latest disaster the search for 10 victims of the mining accident is to go on. This was announced by mission control. The Minister of Economics, Farnleitner, ordered new acoustic measurements for next night. Two other bubbles are surmised to exist in the tunnel system. According to medical judgment it is possible for persons to survive underground for up to two months, if a sufficient supply of air and water were available. The two surmised bubbles are located at a depth of 145 metres and 175 metres, respectively. The rescue team will try to advance with so-called hammer drilling. This kind of drilling is faster but less accurate than the method used so far.
Jagoda pessimistic on labour market development

The President of the Federal Labour Office, Jagoda, is more pessimistic on the development of the labour market then Chancellor Kohl. Jagoda said to the Leipziger Volkszeitung that in discord with the Bonn coalition he does not expect the number of unemployed to decrease below the 4-million level in the fall. Jagoda said he would be quit happy should Kohl's forecast prove true. But in his experience a slight increase in the number of unemployed might be expected for the summer months. As to the question of a turning-point in the labour market, Jagoda also has a different opinion than the federal government. He emphasised that a real turning-point would be reached when the unemployment rate is lower than the year before for three months in a row. Just now, this occurs in Western Germany only.
Glogowski: Border guards will not become a federal police

Lower Saxony's Minister of the Interior, Glogowski, does not see the border guards growing into a federal police force, despite their widened authority. Talking to Deutschlandradio Berlin, the SPD minister said the new scope of authority of the border guards concerning the federal railway was reasonable. Furthermore, this scope of authority would be naturally limited by space and occasion. Nobody will have to be afraid of this widened authority being a step in the direction of establishing a federal police force.
Telekom sets up basic lines for telephone clients

After the telephone chaos this weekend the first lines were reinstalled. Last night more than 100 technicians of the Telekom set up basic communication lines for telephone clients affected by the accident, bringing in mobile exchanges from Goettingen in Lower Saxony. As of today, about 60 major clients should have their telephone lines ready for use again, including Bosch and the County Savings Bank, as well as authorities such as the municipal computer centre, the city administration and the local newspaper. Also, Telekom extended the frequency capacities for mobile phones and distributed mobile phones to important service providers among others. Meanwhile, 160 telephone booths, which went out of action after the fire, are again available to the public.
SAP quoted at the New York Stock exchange

As of today, Germany's largest Software Company, Walldorf based SAP, is being quoted at the New York Stock Exchange. Thereby, SAP will become better known in the international market place and attain the level of its major competitors.
Trial against persons responsible for cableway accident

The persons responsible for the cableway accident in Cabalese, Italy, were arraigned before a US court-martial. The pilot and the navigator are being charged with manslaughter and gross negligence resulting in death. 20 persons died in the accident last February. The trial against the pilot will begin in December. The navigator will have to defend himself in January. In the meantime, relatives of the seven German victims had made claims for compensation. Altogether they demand 35 million US$ from the US Government.
Still hope for the festival theatre in Baden-Baden

The festival theatre in Baden-Baden might possibly be saved. According to the Stuttgarter Nachrichten, the manager has had successful negotiations with interested partners and possible sponsors. So the Dekra will subsidize the festival theatre much more in order to discharge the debts.
No prescriptions for Viagra

There will be no health insurance prescriptions for the potency pill Viagra. The federal committee of physicians and the health insurance companies refused to ad Viagra to the catalogue. The Minister of Health, Seehofer, has as yet to agree with this decision. The remedy will be admitted within the EU late this month or in September.
Dentists deny accusations of overcharging

The Federal General Medical Council of Dentists denies the accusation of private patients having been overcharged by their dentists. The Council declared that the fees are fixed by official decree. This decree is in force and has remained unchanged for ten years. Remarks of Minister of Health Seehofer about auditing private bills might be seen as an exaggeration with electioneering aims.
Audi: No plant vacations

In view of a steep increase in demand, car producer Audi cancelled this year's plant vacation shutdown. In Ingolstadt and Neckarsulm, production will continue, although with reduced unit production. About 12.000 holiday replacement workers will be hired.
